intro: Capnorea, commonly known as the "bluebell of the desert," is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Capnorea thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it an attractive and resilient plant for xeriscaping and native gardens.
